definition: (idiom) reluctant to speak about it/tight-lipped
surname San
three/3
(wooden) box/cup/old variant of 緘|缄[jian1]/letter
letters/to close/to seal
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: As for the two-person conspiracy what, Gong Xiaobin tight- lipped about the same.
sentences.chinese: 至于二人密谋了什么，巩晓彬同样三缄其口。

sentences.english: Since I cannot govern my own tongue, tho'within my own teeth, how can I hope to govern the tongues of others?
sentences.chinese: 既然管不住自己的舌头，又怎么能指望别人三缄其口？

definition: to refuse to say anything about (idiom)/to remain tight-lipped/to avoid mentioning
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
to keep silent (idiom)
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
not to mention (idiom); to say not one word/fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
to play deaf-mute
to speak evasively (idiom); beating about the bush
to withhold information/to keep sth secret
(idiom) "no comment"
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to keep silent
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
to not mention a single word (about sth) (idiom)
to be well aware
